# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

# Solution

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return lowercase(replace(replace(strip(col), r"\s|-" => "_")))
end
```

This function `clean_column` takes a column name (`col`) as an argument. It first strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip()` function. Then, it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace()` function with a regular expression pattern `r"\s|-"` (`\s` for whitespace, `-` for hyphen) as the target and `"_"` as the replacement. Finally, it applies the `lowercase()` function to convert all characters of the cleaned column name into lowercase letters.

Example usage:
```julia
println(clean_column("My Column")) # Outputs "my_column"
println(clean_column("My-Column"))  # Outputs "my_column"
println(clean_column("MyColumn"))   # Outputs "mycolumn"
```
